meta.title: Saga Edition — Conditions (rollable)
meta.notes: Each condition entry includes mechanical effects and, where relevant, rollable damage expressions in standard dice notation.

conditions.name: Normal
conditions.description: No penalties or special status.

conditions.name: Condition Track -1
conditions.description: -1 penalty to all defenses; -1 penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and skill checks.

conditions.name: Condition Track -2
conditions.description: -2 penalty to all defenses; -2 penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and skill checks.

conditions.name: Condition Track -3
conditions.description: -5 penalty to all defenses; -5 penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and skill checks.

conditions.name: Condition Track -4
conditions.description: Move at half speed; -10 penalty to all defenses; -10 penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and skill checks.

conditions.name: Condition Track -5 (Helpless / Unconscious / Disabled)
conditions.description: Helpless: unconscious or disabled. For creatures: unconscious and dying; for droids/objects: disabled.

conditions.name: Prone
conditions.description: Take -5 on melee attacks; attacking a prone target grants +5 melee but -5 ranged.

conditions.name: Flat-footed
conditions.description: Lose Dexterity and Dodge bonuses to Reflex until first turn.

conditions.name: Helpless
conditions.description: Bound, sleeping, unconscious, or otherwise unable to act; DEX = 0 (-5). Vulnerable to coup de grace.

conditions.name: Stunned
conditions.description: Incapacitated and can take no actions; when stunned from stun-setting weapons, apply stun damage rules.

conditions.name: Unconscious
conditions.description: Falls unconscious at 0 HP; make DC10 CON check every minute to regain consciousness; failure becomes persistent condition; failure by 5+ or natural 1 on check results in death.

regain_check.label: CON check to regain consciousness (1 minute intervals)

conditions.name: Dying / At 0 HP
conditions.description: At 0 HP: move -5 CT and fall unconscious; if damage that reduced you to 0 HP ≥ damage threshold, you die.

conditions.name: Dead
conditions.description: Character or object destroyed; can be revived only by specific powers or treatment (Revivify within 1 round using Treat Injury DC25).

conditions.name: Persistent Condition (poison, disease, etc.)
conditions.description: Cannot use Recover or natural healing; requires specific treatment to remove. Effects vary by condition.

conditions.name: Blinded
conditions.description: Can't see, take -2 to Reflex, lose DEX bonus to Reflex, move at half speed, -5 Perception; all opponents have total concealment to you.

conditions.name: Paralyzed
conditions.description: Cannot move or act, treated as helpless, fails saving throws automatically depending on source.

conditions.name: Immobilized
conditions.description: Cannot move but can take other actions if allowed by effect; treated as having movement 0.

conditions.name: Dazed
conditions.description: Able to take only a single move action or standard action, not both; effect specifics depend on source.

conditions.name: Entangled
conditions.description: Move at half speed; -2 to attack rolls and Reflex; escape typically by Strength or Acrobatics check as defined by effect.

conditions.name: Burning
conditions.description: Persistent fire damage each round until extinguished; sample roll provided for automation.

periodic_damage.label: Burning damage per round
periodic_damage.notes: GM may scale dice by source (e.g., larger explosions).

conditions.name: Poisoned
conditions.description: Effects vary by poison; often causes persistent CT loss or periodic damage until cured; sample generic poison roll included.

periodic_damage.label: Poison periodic damage
periodic_damage.notes: Use GM-defined damage and duration for specific poisons.

conditions.name: Ion Damage (living and droid rules)
conditions.description: Living creatures: subtract 1/4 of ion damage from HP; if reduced to 0 by ion, fall unconscious as if stunned. Droids/devices: subtract 1/2 ion damage from HP; if ion (pre-halving) exceeds DT, target moves -2 CT; reducing to 0 disables the droid/device.

conditions.name: Stun setting (weapons)
conditions.description: Stun weapons deal stun damage equal to normal dice; apply half of stun damage to HP; if pre-halved stun damage exceeds DT, target moves -2 CT; if reduces HP to 0, target is unconscious or disabled.

conditions.name: Falling Damage
conditions.description: Make attack roll 1d20 + 20 vs Fort; on success take 1d6 per 2 squares (3m) fallen, up to 20d6; on failed save take half that amount. Landing prone is implied.

save_roll.label: Fortitude check to reduce falling damage
save_roll.interpretation: If roll >= target Fortitude, apply full Xd6; otherwise apply floor(Xd6 / 2)

conditions.name: Critical Hit (auto-critical on coup de grace or nat20)
conditions.description: Natural 20 is always a critical hit. Coup de grace against helpless is automatic critical and lethal. Criticals have effects per weapon rules and may apply extra effects determined by weapon table.

conditions.name: Shield Rating (SR) mechanics
conditions.description: SR absorbs damage up to SR; damage exceeding SR reduces SR by 5 and the remainder hits HP. Recharge: Mechanics DC20 with 3 swift actions to restore 5 SR.

conditions.name: Revivify (revive within 1 round)
conditions.description: Revivify requires Treat Injury DC25 (full-round) and a medkit. Success returns a creature to life but unconscious.

conditions.name: Damage Threshold (DT) effect
conditions.description: If damage taken in a single instance >= target's DT, move -1 CT. If damage that reduced you to 0 HP >= DT, you die.
